Winthrop collection 1974.052Collection processed by Nicholas PavlikThis collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.Brooklyn Historical SocietyBrooklyn Historical Society128 Pierrepont StreetBrooklyn 11201718-222-4111library@brooklynhistory.org
change to complete_collection_levelThis finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2018-11-16T17:20:04EnglishDescribing Archives: A Content StandardNovember 2018
Revised by Maggie Schreiner to reflect augmented description
Brooklyn Historical Society
Robert C. Winthrop collection
Winthrop, Robert C. (Robert Charles)
1974.052
0.22 Linear Feet in seven folders in one manuscript box and one oversize folder.
1664-1699 This collection documents early Colonial property transactions in the Long Island towns of Brookhaven and Southold. Materials include, deeds, indetures, patents and warrents, and involve the Unkechaug Native Americans and English colonial administrator Edmund Andros.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date (if known); Robert C. Winthrop collection, 1974.052, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
Conditions Governing Access
Open to researchers without restriction.
Processing Information
Minimally processed to the collection level in 2011. Description was augmented in 2018, and at this time materials were rehoused.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Gift of Robert C. Winthrop, 1890.
